headline: Workday (WDAY) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of finance and HR software company Workday (NASDAQ:WDAY) jumped 9.2% in the morning session after the S&P Dow Jones Indices announced that Workday would join the S&P 500 Index before the start of trading on Monday, December 23, 2024. The S&P 500 is a widely followed index that tracks the performance of the 500 largest companies in the United States. Being included in the Index means that Workday will likely be held by many mutual funds and ETFs, which could potentially drive up demand for

headline: Why Apollo Global and Workday are being added to the S&P 500
summary: Apollo Global Management (APO) and Workday (WDAY) are set to join the S&P 500 (^GSPC), replacing the Qorvo (QRVO) and Amentum (AMTM) as part of a rebalancing of the index. Ahead of the change, which takes effect before the start of trading on Monday, Dec. 23, Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre explains why the stocks are being added to the index and take a look at Apollo and Workday's performance ahead of their S&P 500 inclusion. Disclosure: Yahoo Finance is owned by Apollo Global Management. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Wealth! This post was written by Naomi Buchanan,

headline: Apollo Global and Workday set to join S&P 500: What to know
summary: Apollo Global (APO) and Workday (WDAY) are set to join the S&P 500 (^GSPC) before the start of trading on Monday, Dec. 23. The stocks are replacing Qorvo (QRVO) and Amentum (AMTM) as part of a rebalancing of the index. Morning Brief Hosts Seana Smith and Brad Smith take a closer look at what investors need to know. Disclosure: Yahoo Finance is owned by Apollo Global Management. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Apollo Global, Workday higher on S&P 500 inclusion
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) and Workday (NASDAQ:WDAY) rose Monday after it was revealed the companies are set to join the S&P 500, replacing Qorvo (NASDAQ:QRVO) and Amentum Holdings, effective before market open on December 23.
